description: Brown lamb pieces in a skillet with a little oil.
Place lamb in a baking dish and cover with rice and water.
Bake in the oven at 375°F for 30 minutes.
Whisk together yogurt, eggs, and flour; pour over the lamb and rice.
Return to oven and bake until the topping is golden and set.
Serve hot.
Prepare phyllo dough and layer half in a greased baking dish.
Mix chopped walnuts, sugar, and cinnamon; spread over the phyllo.
Top with the remaining phyllo, brushing each layer with melted butter.
Cut into diamonds and bake at 350°F until golden and crisp.
Pour syrup made from sugar, water, and lemon juice over the hot pastry.
Allow to cool before serving.
Sauté chopped onions and bell peppers in olive oil until soft.
Add chopped tomatoes and simmer until the mixture thickens.
Stir in crumbled cottage cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Cook until everything is heated through.
Serve warm with crusty bread.
Prepare rice according to package instructions.
Mix cooked rice with chopped herbs, garlic, and precooked shrimp.
Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds.
Stuff peppers with rice mixture, place in a baking dish.
Bake at 375°F until peppers are soft and filling is hot.
Serve with lemon wedges.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Sauté spinach until wilted, then mix with crumbled feta cheese and eggs.
Layer phyllo sheets in a greased baking pan, brushing each with oil.
Spread spinach mixture over phyllo, then cover with more phyllo sheets.
Bake until golden brown.
Cut into squares and serve.
Soak beans overnight, then drain and rinse.
Sauté onions and garlic in a pot until translucent.
Add beans, water, and chopped tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Cook covered on low heat for 2 hours until beans are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of chili powder.
Serve hot with bread.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Prepare cake batter with eggs, sugar, and ground walnuts.
Pour into a greased pan and bake until a toothpick comes out clean.
Simultaneously, prepare syrup with sugar, water, and lemon juice.
Pour hot syrup over the hot cake after removing from oven.
Let absorb and cool before serving.
Cook rice until tender, then mix with beaten eggs, chopped mint, and salt.
Heat oil in a deep skillet.
Form rice mixture into small balls and fry until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
Slice zucchini, bell peppers, eggplants, and tomatoes into even pieces.
Marinate with olive oil, garlic, and herbs.
Grill on high heat until vegetables are tender and have grill marks.
Serve hot or at room temperature, garnished with fresh basil.
Clean mussels and discard any that are open and do not close when tapped.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet, add minced garlic, and sauté until fragrant.
Add mussels and cover with white wine, simmer until mussels open.
Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve hot.
Serve with pasta or fresh bread.
Form ground beef into patties and season with salt and pepper.
Grill patties on medium-high heat until desired doneness.
Place a slice of cheese on each patty in the last minute of cooking to melt.
Toast hamburger buns on the grill.
Assemble the burgers by placing lettuce, tomato, patty with cheese, onions, and pickles on the bun.
Serve with ketchup, mustard, or mayonnaise.
Prepare the pie crust and line a pie dish with one layer of crust.
Mix sliced apples with sugar, cinnamon, and flour.
Fill the pie crust with the apple mixture.
Cover with the second layer of crust, seal edges, and cut small slits in the top.
Bake at 375°F until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
Combine flour, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder in a bowl.
Dip chicken pieces in beaten eggs, then dredge in flour mixture.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large skillet to 350°F.
Fry chicken until crispy and cooked through, about 10 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve.
Cook macaroni according to package instructions; drain.
In a saucepan, melt butter and stir in flour to make a roux.
Gradually add milk to the roux, stirring constantly until thickened.
Remove from heat and mix in grated cheese until melted.
Combine cheese sauce with macaroni, transfer to a baking dish, and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.
Optionally, top with breadcrumbs and bake until golden.
Rub ribs with a mixture of paprika, garlic powder, salt, and sugar.
Wrap ribs in foil and bake at 275°F for 3 hours until tender.
Remove ribs from foil, brush with barbecue sauce, and grill for 10 minutes on each side.
Serve with extra barbecue sauce.
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk together milk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed; some lumps are okay.
Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat and pour batter to form pancakes.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve with butter and maple syrup.
Cream together butter and sugars until fluffy.
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
Mix in flour, baking soda, and salt.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet and bake at 350°F for 10 minutes or until golden.
Cool on a wire rack before serving.
Cook bacon until crispy.
Toast slices of bread.
Spread mayonnaise on one side of each slice of bread.
Layer crispy bacon, sliced tomatoes, and lettuce leaves on one slice, then top with another slice of bread.
Cut in half and serve.
Cook chopped bacon until crisp; set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onions and celery until soft.
Add potatoes, clams with juice, water, and seasonings; simmer until potatoes are tender.
Stir in cream and heat through without boiling.
Serve garnished with crispy bacon and oyster crackers.
Melt butter and chocolate together.
Stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract.
Mix in flour, cocoa powder, and salt.
Fold in additional chocolate chunks.
Pour batter into a greased baking pan and bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
Cool in pan before cutting into squares and serving.
Chop tomatoes, cucumbers, and onions into bite-sized pieces.
Combine in a bowl and season with salt and olive oil.
Top with grated sirene cheese and a sprinkle of parsley before serving.
Brown the meat in a pot with some oil.
Add chopped onions, peppers, and mushrooms to the pot and sauté until soft.
Stir in paprika, a splash of white wine, and tomato paste. Cover and simmer for an hour.
Season with salt, pepper, and fresh herbs before serving.
Mix beaten eggs with crumbled sirene cheese and yogurt.
Layer sheets of phyllo dough in a greased baking dish, brushing each with melted butter.
Spread the egg and cheese mixture between layers of phyllo.
Bake at 375°F until golden brown and puffed.
Cut into squares and serve hot.
Mix flour, yeast, and yogurt to form a soft dough. Let it rise until doubled.
Heat oil in a deep fryer.
Roll out small pieces of dough and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with powdered sugar, or serve with honey or jam.
Layer thinly sliced potatoes and seasoned minced meat in a baking dish.
Mix eggs with yogurt and pour over the layers.
Bake at 350°F until the top is golden and the potatoes are tender.
Allow to set before serving.
Combine yogurt with water to a soup-like consistency.
Add finely chopped cucumbers, crushed garlic, chopped dill, and crushed walnuts.
Season with salt and olive oil.
Chill in the fridge for at least an hour before serving.
Layer kadaif dough in a tray, interspersing with mixed nuts.
Bake until golden brown.
Pour a hot syrup made of sugar, water, and lemon juice over the baked kadaif.
Let it cool and absorb the syrup before serving.
Toast bread slices lightly.
Spread a thick layer of grated Bulgarian cheese on each slice.
Broil in the oven until the cheese is bubbly and golden.
Optionally top with a fried egg and serve immediately.
Prepare walnut sponge layers by beating egg whites with sugar and folding in ground walnuts and flour.
Bake each layer separately until set.
Prepare chocolate ganache with heavy cream and dark chocolate.
Assemble the cake by layering sponge and ganache, finishing with a ganache topping.
Chill in the fridge to set before serving.
Prepare cabbage leaves by boiling until tender.
Mix minced meat with rice, onions, and spices.
Place a spoonful of the filling on each leaf and roll tightly.
Arrange the rolls in a pot, cover with tomato sauce and water.
Simmer on low heat until the meat and rice are fully cooked.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs.
Slice beef into thin strips.
Season beef with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and sauté onions until translucent.
Add beef to the pan and brown.
Reduce heat and add mustard and beef broth. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in sour cream and cook for another 5 minutes without boiling.
Serve hot over noodles or rice.
Mix honey, sugar, and eggs in a bowl.
Add baking soda and melt mixture over steam until it increases in volume.
Mix flour into the warm honey mixture to form dough.
Divide the dough into 8 parts, roll out each and bake for 5 minutes at 350°F.
Whisk sour cream with sugar and vanilla.
Spread cream between each cooled cake layer.
Coat the outside with leftover cream and crumble a baked dough layer on top.
Chill in fridge overnight before serving.
Peel and chop all vegetables.
Sauté onions and carrots in a pot.
Add beets and continue to sauté for a few minutes.
Add water, cabbage, and potatoes and bring to a boil.
Simmer until all vegetables are tender.
Add vinegar, sugar, and salt to taste.
Serve with sour cream and fresh dill.
Mix flour, eggs, water, and salt to form a dough.
Roll dough thin and cut into circles.
Place a small amount of meat filling in the center of each circle.
Fold dough over and seal edges to form a dumpling.
Boil dumplings in salted water until they float to the surface.
Serve hot with melted butter or sour cream.
Mix tvorog, eggs, flour, sugar, and vanilla.
Form small patties from the mixture.
Fry patties in a hot, oiled pan until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with sour cream or jam.
Rinse buckwheat groats under cold water.
Bring water to a boil and add groats.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until groats are tender and water is absorbed.
Serve hot with milk or as a side dish to meat.
Mix honey, sugar, and spices in a bowl.
Add eggs and melted butter, then blend in flour to form a stiff dough.
Roll out dough and cut into shapes.
Bake at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.
Mix powdered sugar with lemon juice to make icing.
Glaze cookies after they have cooled.
Puree apples and mix with sugar.
Heat mixture until sugar dissolves.
Whip egg whites to stiff peaks.
Gradually combine hot fruit mixture with egg whites.
Pipe onto parchment paper into desired shapes.
Let dry at room temperature for 12 hours.
Boil potatoes, carrots, and eggs until cooked.
Dice all cooked ingredients and pickles.
Combine in a bowl with peas and diced chicken.
Mix thoroughly with mayonnaise.
Chill before serving.
Sauté onions and carrots in a pot.
Add meat (beef or pork) and sauté until browned.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add chopped cabbage and potatoes, simmer until all ingredients are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and herbs before serving.
Serve with a dollop of sour cream.
Heat oil in a large pot and sauté onions, carrots, and beets.
Add beef stock and bring to a boil.
Add sliced potatoes and cook until tender.
Add shredded cabbage and cook for another 10 minutes.
Season with vinegar, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and dill.
Mix farmer's cheese, eggs, flour, sugar, and vanilla extract to form a thick batter.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Form small patties from the batter and fry until golden brown on both sides.
Serve warm with sour cream or your favorite preserves.
Prepare the dough by mixing flour, water, and a pinch of salt.
Roll out the dough and cut into circles.
Place a spoonful of filling on each dough circle.
Fold the dough over and seal the edges tightly.
Boil in salted water until they rise to the surface, then remove with a slotted spoon.
Serve hot with melted butter, sautéed onions, or sour cream.
Grate potatoes and onions and squeeze out excess moisture.
Mix with eggs, flour, salt, and pepper.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Spoon potato mixture into the skillet and flatten to form pancakes.
Fry until crispy and golden on both sides.
Serve hot with sour cream or apple sauce.
Blanch cabbage leaves until soft enough to roll.
Mix ground meat, rice, onion, and spices.
Place a portion of the meat mixture on each cabbage leaf and roll tightly.
Arrange rolls in a baking dish and cover with tomato sauce.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F for 2 hours.
Serve hot.
Heat water and sour cream in a pot until boiling.
Gradually whisk in cornmeal until the mixture thickens.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until porridge is creamy.
Top with pork cracklings and shredded cheese before serving.
Prepare yeast dough and let it rise until doubled.
Form dough into small balls and let rise again.
Fry in deep oil until golden brown.
Roll in sugar or fill with jam after cooling slightly.
Brown sausage or pork in a pot.
Add chopped onions, carrots, and potatoes, and sauté until soft.
Add shredded sour cabbage and water, bring to a boil.
Simmer for at least 1.5 hours until all flavors meld.
Season with salt, pepper, and bay leaves.
Serve hot with a spoonful of sour cream.
Soak wheat berries overnight, then boil until tender.
Mix boiled wheat with honey, poppy seeds, and chopped nuts.
Serve cold as part of a traditional Christmas Eve supper.
Prepare thin crepe batter and cook crepes in a non-stick skillet.
Mix cottage cheese with eggs and herbs for filling.
Fill each crepe with the cheese mixture, roll tightly.
Optionally, place rolled crepes in a baking dish, cover with cream sauce, and bake.
Serve hot.
